summary: This email chain from October 19, 2007, discusses the selection of a special master's attorney representative in the Epstein case, mentions a search of David Copperfield's warehouse in connection with a rape allegation, and discusses Epstein's legal strategy regarding a civil lawsuit and guilty plea.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: Epstein's favorite cohort; FBI searched his warehouse in connection with rape allegations; he spoke with girls at Epstein's home and backstage passes were a gift from Epstein to girls.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Was supposed to send comments on a proposed letter but had not done so yet.

persons.name: Judge Davis
persons.context: The special master who had not yet made a selection of an attorney representative; the author considers calling to ask about the status.

connections.description: Epstein's favorite cohort; Copperfield spoke with girls at Epstein's home and tickets with backstage passes were a favorite birthday gift from Epstein to the girls.
Implied connection through allegations and shared interactions with girls; FBI search of Copperfield's warehouse in connection with rape allegations mentioned in context of Epstein case.

events.title: FBI search of David Copperfield's warehouse
events.description: FBI Seattle and FBI Las Vegas executed a search on a warehouse owned by David Copperfield in connection with allegations that Copperfield raped an adult female.

events.title: Lawsuit filed by girl in New York
events.description: A lawsuit filed by a girl in New York made national news; Epstein's group is concerned the guilty plea will be used against him in civil suits and wants to knock that lawsuit out before the guilty plea to deter others.

events.title: Delay in change of plea
events.description: The national news coverage of the New York lawsuit is speculated to be the real reason for the delay in Epstein's change of plea.

events.title: Planting of false stories
events.description: Newspapers reported that Epstein's camp had planted false stories about girls who 'just sat in his kitchen' filing suit in an attempt to discredit the girls.

keyFacts: FBI searched a warehouse owned by David Copperfield on October 19, 2007, in connection with rape allegations, linking him to Epstein as 'Epstein's favorite cohort.'
Epstein's legal team was concerned about a civil lawsuit filed by a girl in New York, which had made national news, potentially delaying his guilty plea.
Epstein's camp was accused of planting false stories to discredit the girls who were filing suits against him.
The special master, Judge Davis, had not yet selected an attorney representative, causing concern among the girls who were receiving calls from attorneys.
